note.p: Career: Joined the Royal Navy (1845); served in the Pacific, and on a Franklin search expedition; Lieutenant (1845); served in the Crimea; Commander (1862); Captain, HMS Challenger; explored the Southern Ocean (1872); led the expedition of HMS Alert and Discovery to the North Pole (1874); surveyed the Magellan Straits (1878); in the Habour Department, Board of Trade (1879-1886); Rear Admiral (1887); Vice Admiral (1892); Consevator of River Mersey (1896-1910).
Places or features named after him include: Nares Harbour, Admiralty Islands; Nares Deep, North Atlantic; Nares Land, Greenland; Capes Nares, Grant Land; Mount Nares, South Victoria Land
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1914-1915 vol 91 pp lii-liii signed by C R M
